document_title: Sphenoid sinusitis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
Acute sphenoid sinusitis is often associated with bacterial infections, such as Haemophilus influenza and Streptococcus pneumonia (strep throat). These types of infections often develop as a result of a pre-existing sinus condition, starting from a viral infection, such as the common cold or flu.
Sphenoid sinusitis can also be triggered by allergens or a fungal infection that develops into a sinus infection, spreading into the sphenoidal cavities.
If left untreated, the irritated tissues in the sinuses can provide an ideal environment for bacteria to grow.
